Package Main

Class Athlete

java.lang.Object
Main.GameEnvironment
Main.Purchasable
Main.Athlete
public class Athlete extends Main.Purchasable
Author:
Dominic Dumble, Nathan Scott Athlete Class extends the methods in Purchasable and is used to control the actual individual athletes. The Athlete Class stores the relevant stats of each individual player, their nickname, and position, as well as injuries. Through this class, various methods are available to retrieve information about each athlete.

  • Constructor Details

    • Athlete

      public Athlete(float cost, int aStat, int dStat, int stam)
      A new athlete is initialised in this function. The following parameters are fed into the function, and the first and last name is generated randomly and assigned to the name of the player. Nothing is returned from this function
      Parameters:
      cost - is the cost to purchase the athlete
      aStat - is the attack stats of the athlete
      dStat - is the defence stats of the athlete
      stam - is the stamina stats of the player

  • Method Details

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(int playerInput)
      This function takes the player input to select the position of the athlete
      Parameters:
      playerInput - is an integer representing the desired position for the athlete

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname(String word)
      This function allows the player to set the nickname of the respective athlete, this nickname will be displayed in place of the name for the duration of the name
      Parameters:
      word - is the string assigned to the nickname

    • getStats

      public int[] getStats()
      This function builds an array showing the different stats of the respective athlete
      Returns:
      int[] of player stats

    • getName

      public String[] getName()
      This function makes an array, the first element showing the name, and the second showing the nickname
      Returns:
      String[] with the two names

    • getPosition

      public int getPosition()
      This function will return the position of the player
      Returns:
      position

    • dropStamina

      public Boolean dropStamina(int decrease)
      This function decreases the stamina of the athlete. If the stamina drops below 0, the injury count of the athlete will increase by 1
      Returns:
      stamina <= 0

    • statIncrease

      public void statIncrease(int stat, int increase)
      This function increases one of the stats for the player
      Parameters:
      stat - selects which stat to increase
      increase - will increase the chosen stat by the amount defined

    • getInjuries

      public int getInjuries()
      This function will return the number of injuries of the respective athlete
      Returns:
      injuries

    • rest

      public void rest()
      This function replenishes the athletes stamina to 100

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
